docs.snippet: FAIRCHILD--Robert F., of New York and Quogue died suddenly on February 16th, after enjoying a wonderful weekend fishing on his boat, The Grand Cru. Beloved father of Stephanie and Roger Griswold, Suzie and Bruce Kovner, Samantha and Chris Storkers...
docs.lead_paragraph: FAIRCHILD--Robert F., of New York and Quogue died suddenly on February 16th, after enjoying a wonderful weekend fishing on his boat, The Grand Cru. Beloved father of Stephanie and Roger Griswold, Suzie and Bruce Kovner, Samantha and Chris Storkerson, Serena and Tyler Sheldon; cherished grandfather of Caroline, Olivia, Liam, Oscar, Roger, and Margaux. Born and raised in New York City, Bob graduated from the University of Pennsylvania and went to work for the family's firm, Fairchild Publications. Bob joined The House of Burgundy in 1971, and is the President and Chief Executive Officer. In May of 1994, he founded the Maison des Grands Crus, in Santenay, France. On July 16, 1987 in recognition of his efforts on behalf of French wines, Bob was made a Chevalier of the Ordre du Merite Agicole, by the French Parliament. Bob is a member of the Board of Overseers of the University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine, and the Board of Trustees of the Avon Old Farms School. A former member of the Board of Governors of the Union League Club of New York, he also belongs to the Leash Club of New York, Bath and Tennis Club of Palm Beach, Quogue Field Club and Quogue Beach Club and the Long Island Wyandanch Club. Family will receive friends on Thursday, 7-9pm and Friday 2-4pm and 7-9pm at Frank E. Campbell, 1076 Madison Avenue at 81st Street. Funeral service will be held on Saturday at 10:30am at St. Thomas More, 89th Street (between Madison and Park Avenues). In lieu of flowers, please make donations to The University of Pennsylvania School of Veterinary Medicine or Avon Old Farms School.

docs.snippet: 10 P.M. (SoapNet) BEING ERICA Do over! Erica Strange (Erin Karpluk, right), a smart, sexy and underachieving 32-year-old, finds her world irrevocably changed when she seeks treatment for a premature midlife crisis from Dr. Tom (Michael Riley), a r...
docs.lead_paragraph: 10 P.M. (SoapNet) BEING ERICA Do over! Erica Strange (Erin Karpluk, right), a smart, sexy and underachieving 32-year-old, finds her world irrevocably changed when she seeks treatment for a premature midlife crisis from Dr. Tom (Michael Riley), a roguish therapist, in the American premiere of this Canadian series. His prescription for mental health: Travel back in time and right past wrongs. 9 A.M. (ABC) LIVE WITH REGIS AND KELLYKevin Bacon talks about his coming HBO film, ''Taking Chance''; the New Kids on the Block perform.

docs.snippet: A memorial tribute to the folk singer Odetta will be held on Tuesday at 7 p.m. at Riverside Church, Riverside Drive, at 122nd Street, in Morningside Heights. Odetta, whose voice was a resonant force throughout the civil-rights movement and for dec...
docs.lead_paragraph: A memorial tribute to the folk singer Odetta will be held on Tuesday at 7 p.m. at Riverside Church, Riverside Drive, at 122nd Street, in Morningside Heights. Odetta, whose voice was a resonant force throughout the civil-rights movement and for decades afterward, died on Dec. 2 at 77. The memorial is open to the public and free of charge. Bernice Johnson Reagon and Tom Chapin are to serve as hosts of the event, which is scheduled to include music and readings by David Amram, Maya Angelou, Harry Belafonte, Oscar Brand, Ruby Dee, Geoffrey Holder, Pete Seeger, Sweet Honey in the Rock, Wavy Gravy, Peter Yarrow and others. Doors open at 6 p.m.
